application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun no later than three years from the date of this decision notice.Reason: To comply with the provision of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in complete accordance with the approved plans and drawings listed in this decision notice, other than where those details are altered pursuant to conditions of this planning permission. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

All new external work and finishes and work of making good shall match the original work in respect of the materials, colour, texture, profile and finished appearance, except where indicated otherwise on the drawings hereby approved or unless otherwise required by condition. Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the host building and the significance of the Poet's Corner Conservation Area. (Policies Q5, Q8, Q11 and Q22 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021)).

The flat roof areas hereby approved shall not be used as a balcony, terrace, sitting out or other amenity area in order to protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers.  Reason: To safeguard the amenity of neighbouring occupiers (Policy Q2 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021)).

Notwithstanding the approved plans, all proposed rooflights shall be traditional appearance, painted black metal and lying flush with the roof plane with an integral vertical glazing bar.   Reason: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and so that it preserves the character and appearance of the Poet's Corner Conservation Area (Policies Q5, Q8, Q11 and Q22 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021)) and the Lambeth Design Guide SPD (2023).

Notwithstanding the approved plans, the link roof shall be a seamless continuation of the dormer roof without facias or gutters.Reason: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and so that it preserves the character and appearance of the Poet's Corner Conservation Area (Policies Q5, Q8, Q11 and Q22 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021)) and the Lambeth Design Guide SPD (2023).
